intro: Lesquerella kaibabensis, commonly known as the Kaibab lesquerella, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, such as the Kaibab Plateau in Arizona. It has small, pinnately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
